title: September 9
description:
Tuesday was Felix's first day of kindergarten and Milo's first day of "real" (non-play) preschool. Both of them started at École Bilingue de Berkeley, a.k.a. ÉB.

Both boys were excited and happy to be there the first day, but on the following days Milo has dissolved into tears. The teachers say he cries periodically during the day. It's not too surprising, given that he just spent a solid month with Lucie all day every day, but it makes us sad. We hope he makes friends soon and settles into his new routines.

Felix is doing great. He came home the first day knowing more about sunflowers than we did. He'd learned it all from his garden teacher, who they meet once a week in the school's organic garden. On the second day he sang us a song (a song!) in French (in French!!) at the dinner table. We love that he is coming home with an actual education. Dean's still a little touchy about the price, though: it feels like it's working out to $500 per fact.

Felix doesn't seem anxious at all about making friends: he hasn't made any good friends yet, but he knows it takes time. When Lucie points out kids and says, "Have you played with her yet?" he'll say things like, "No, but she's pretty timide. She's not my friend yet."

This weekend Felix played a game where he pretended to be his teacher and ran through a day at class, with Milo and Lucie as the students. It was highly edifying as to his routine and the day's highlights through a five year old's eyes.

Dean is using his occasional Nintendo Wii-playing with Felix to teach about sportsmanship and the love of the game.

  • Felix: Games aren't about winning, they're about having fun. It doesn't matter if you win.
  • Dean: Well, try to win. It feels good if you win. But if you don't win, it's still fun to have played.
  • Felix: Winning makes you feel like a KING!
  • Dean: Exactly!

children.title: First Day at EB
children.description:
The first day of school! You can tell that there was some trepidation mixed in Felix's excitement. Milo was blissfully unconcerned about the big event.

Felix has been riding his bike to school every other day. The ride is 30 minutes going and 45 minutes back. The other days, Felix squeezes into the bike trailer with Milo.

children.title: Felix's classroom
children.description: Felix's classroom. In the front is his main teacher, Sarah. There is also an assistant, David  (back turned, green plaid shirt), and an English teacher, Faye, who replaces Sarah one  hour a day.

children.title: Goodbye kiss
children.description:
Lucie gives Felix one last kiss before heading out.

Felix is playing with Addison and Parker, identical twin brothers. We had a couple of playdates with them before starting school because they happen to live on our street. Only 4 of the 18 kids in Felix's class live in Berkeley!

children.title: Dean at EB
children.description: Dean rode his motorcycle to EB to see the kids off on their first day.

children.title: Emmett is 5
children.description:
Cindee, Milo, Torin, Darshan, Maya, Felix, Owen and Katherine.

We saw the old New School gang at Emmett's 5 year old birthday party. It was good to see familiar faces and compare notes on transitioning to new schools.

children.title: Emmett is 5
children.description:
Go Emmett!

Emmett just started kindergarten at the Waldorf school, where he spends 80% of his time outdoors, and where he won't be taught to read and write before 3rd grade. They don't use books much, but they teach knitting and carpentry. Education comes in many flavors in the Bay Area.

children.title: Emmett is 5
children.description: Keven and Gilian, Emmett's parents, in their best PJs. This was a breakfast birthday party.

children.title: The Frasers
children.description: Janice and Jason Fraser (Evan's parents), looking fabulous.

children.title: Adventure Playground
children.description: Once again, Adventure Playground delivers on the fun. There was a roller coaster of sorts made of an old slide and an dilapidated boat carcass.

children.title: Adventure Playground
children.description: Whooooooshhhh

children.title: Adventure Playground
children.description: Oh my god! Evan painted his name in Japanese on the plank! Evan just started kindergarten as well. He is in a Japanese immersion program in a San Francisco public school. He gets 1 hour of day of Japanese instruction, plus additional Japanese cultural and language touches throughout the day. He loves it.

children.title: Adventure Playground
children.description: This contraption is just as dangerous as it looks. Felix got pinned under it at one point.

children.title: Adventure Playground
children.description: But damn, it was also as much fun as it looks.

children.title: Flip
children.description: Milo is a bundle of raw protons. We feel like we need to channel his energy in some outlet (gymnastics? martial art? soccer?), but we haven't figured out the right thing yet. Meanwhile he does flips on the living room sofa.

children.title: Ice cream
children.description: Dean bought an ice cream maker. So far we've experimented with strawberry ice cream recipes. Next: coffee ice cream.

children.title: Boys
children.description: 3-way wrestling without any tears is harder than it looks.

children.title: Mount Tam
children.description: We climbed to the top of Mount Tam.  Its full name is "Tamalpais" but no one knows how to pronounce that.

children.title: Mount Tam
children.description: This was taken seconds before we made the mistake of mentioning the rattlesnake Dean had seen on a previous hike in the area.  The next 30 minutes were spent in full reassurance / damage control mode.

children.title: Mount Tam
children.description: We had our picnic in a theatre with a grand view.

children.title: Mount Tam
children.description: Felix likes hiking.

children.title: Mount Tam
children.description: Milo likes hiking in very small doses. After a few minutes he begs to be carried.

children.title: Tam Tower
children.description: The fire watchtower at the tippy top.

children.title: Tam Bench
children.description: From the top of Mount Tam you can see the bay, Berkeley, Oakland, the Richmond Bridge and a thick layer of fog where San Francisco and the Bay Bridge should be.

children.title: Tam Trees
children.description: On our way back down we stopped in the clouds. It was damp and cool.

children.title: Tam Dam 1
children.description: Thank you GPS!  We discovered a reservoir we didn't know existed.

children.title: Tam Dam 2
children.description: Dams are cool.
